title: SS.PT.061
prompt:
In 1963 Ernesto Miranda was convicted of a crime that he confessed to under police interrogation. This led to the U.S. Supreme Court ruling that criminal suspects must be informed of their right to consult with an attorney prior to questioning by the police. This is known as the Miranda rights.

Which amendment led to this decision by the U.S. Supreme Court?
feedback: The Fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution is part of the Bill of Rights. It protects U.S. Citizens against unfair treatment in the legal process. The Supreme Court ruled that the police were required to inform suspects of this Constitutional right.
